intro: Taraxacum anguliferum, commonly known as the angular dandelion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, angular leaves with a distinctive waxy coating. The plant produces a yellow composite flower head that develops into a spherical, fluffy seed head known as a pappus. It is native to Europe and is often found in disturbed soils and open areas. Due to its hardy nature, it is considered a common weed in many regions.
